Articles.Content:
@Pizzaoverhead: Are you still working on this, or it has been put on hold due to other projects?

Yes, this is still my main project, though I've had less time than I'd like to work on it lately.
I look really forward to it. Was using it in 0.23 (or 0.23.5?) and really liked how the rocket got quieter and then how the sonic boom approached

Oh! That's very nice to hear! I really like this project, it would be an utter shame for it to be left unattended. But then again, don't feel pressured into sacrificing time to work on this. Take it at your pace! ;D

Yes, this is still my main project, though I've had less time than I'd like to work on it lately.

Sweet! Good to hear that this isn't abandoned; Definitely a part of my *must have* to add to the environment!! Goes well with KerbQuake
So this is not currently working for 0.90?
It works with all engines except the sabre and the nasa parts.

Mod seems to work great for the most part, however as others noted, the game can go completely unplayable when using a bunch of rapiers. I hope this gets some updates in the near future, KSP feels a tiny bit less fascinating without ASE, now where I tried it.
1.0 has completely killed ASE which is terrible. I got so used to silence that when I ran up the Poodle, I thought I had a bug

1.0 has completely killed ASE which is terrible. I got so used to silence that when I ran up the Poodle, I thought I had a bug

How has it killed it?

Do you mean that its broken by 1.0?

or that its features are included in 1.0 so that ASE is no longer needed?

How has it killed it?

Do you mean that its broken by 1.0?

or that its features are included in 1.0 so that ASE is no longer needed?

As in it no longer works.

ASE worked pretty closely with the aerodynamics system, so there'll need to be some changes now that the old one was scrapped. On the plus side, things should be much more accurate with the new temperature system and there's lots to hook into there.
Cool, this mod was great, and I would really like to see it working again!
Great news Pizzaoverhead
Oof, coming back to KSP after a hiatus for a few versions, makes me appreciate how much I miss this mod!

Dam I wish this would work with KSP 1 it had such an immersive effect.

Edited May 5, 2015 by Jax Pok
I'm still looking for a fix for engines using EFFECTS nodes (NASA parts, RAPIER and now also the aircraft engines), but for now, here's an updated version for 1.0.

I'm still looking for a fix for engines using EFFECTS nodes (NASA parts, RAPIER and now also the aircraft engines), but for now, here's an updated version for 1.0.

=OOOOOO I've been waiting to use this mods for ages

Thanks for coming back, and in case you've missed, there's an utility for package handling of mods that allows automatic updates, CKAN please check it out if you can you can use it.
oh wow!

I'm still looking for a fix for engines using EFFECTS nodes (NASA parts, RAPIER and now also the aircraft engines), but for now, here's an updated version for 1.0.

Thank you for continuing work on this mod! I've missed it a lot and look forward to using it again.

Hey,

could you please add this mod to ckan?

grettings

postremus
Sweet! Thought this had been abandoned thanks so much for continuing development!
Nice! Love this mod.

I have a small request, could you make it so the config file have sensible description to it, its not quite possible to tune in the optional settings right now.

I would like to hear them muffled sounds instead, as its useful to know for stages toggle and stuff. I think it would also be cool I f we could hear as if we were inside the craft.

Edited May 8, 2015 by Gfurst

I wish I would've found this mod before 1.0, because it's EXACTLY what I always wanted! Unfortunately, since I mostly want it for jets, and I use Hot Rockets so every last one of my engines has an "EFFECT" on it, it doesn't do much for me now.

Keep up the great work and I sure hope you can work around the problem with EFFECTs. I'm really looking forward to using this!
FYI, the F3 menu seems to reset sound muffling in space.
